26 #ifndef REACTPHYSICS3D_VECTOR2_H
27 #define REACTPHYSICS3D_VECTOR2_H
28 
29 // Libraries
30 #include <cassert>
31 #include <reactphysics3d/mathematics/mathematics_functions.h>
32 #include <reactphysics3d/decimal.h>
33 
35 namespace reactphysics3d {
36 
37 // Class Vector2
41 struct Vector2 {
42 
43  public:
44 
45  // -------------------- Attributes -------------------- //
46 
48  decimal x;
49 
51  decimal y;
52 
53  // -------------------- Methods -------------------- //
54 
56  Vector2();
57 
59  Vector2(decimal newX, decimal newY);
60 
62  void setAllValues(decimal newX, decimal newY);
63 
65  void setToZero();
66 
68  decimal length() const;
69 
71  decimal lengthSquare() const;
72 
74  Vector2 getUnit() const;
75 
77  Vector2 getOneUnitOrthogonalVector() const;
78 
80  bool isUnit() const;
81 
83  bool isFinite() const;
84 
86  bool isZero() const;
87 
89  decimal dot(const Vector2& vector) const;
90 
92  void normalize();
93 
95  Vector2 getAbsoluteVector() const;
96 
98  int getMinAxis() const;
99 
101  int getMaxAxis() const;
102 
104  bool operator== (const Vector2& vector) const;
105 
107  bool operator!= (const Vector2& vector) const;
108 
110  Vector2& operator+=(const Vector2& vector);
111 
113  Vector2& operator-=(const Vector2& vector);
114 
116  Vector2& operator*=(decimal number);
117 
119  Vector2& operator/=(decimal number);
120 
122  decimal& operator[] (int index);
123 
125  const decimal& operator[] (int index) const;
126 
128  bool operator<(const Vector2& vector) const;
129 
131  std::string to_string() const;
132 
134  static Vector2 min(const Vector2& vector1, const Vector2& vector2);
135 
137  static Vector2 max(const Vector2& vector1, const Vector2& vector2);
138 
140  static Vector2 zero();
141 
142  // -------------------- Friends -------------------- //
143 
144  friend Vector2 operator+(const Vector2& vector1, const Vector2& vector2);
145  friend Vector2 operator-(const Vector2& vector1, const Vector2& vector2);
146  friend Vector2 operator-(const Vector2& vector);
147  friend Vector2 operator*(const Vector2& vector, decimal number);
148  friend Vector2 operator*(decimal number, const Vector2& vector);
149  friend Vector2 operator*(const Vector2& vector1, const Vector2& vector2);
150  friend Vector2 operator/(const Vector2& vector, decimal number);
151  friend Vector2 operator/(const Vector2& vector1, const Vector2& vector2);
152 };
153 
154 // Constructor
155 RP3D_FORCE_INLINE Vector2::Vector2() : x(0.0), y(0.0) {
156 
157 }
158 
159 // Constructor with arguments
160 RP3D_FORCE_INLINE Vector2::Vector2(decimal newX, decimal newY) : x(newX), y(newY) {
161 
162 }
163 
164 // Set the vector to zero
165 RP3D_FORCE_INLINE void Vector2::setToZero() {
166  x = 0;
167  y = 0;
168 }
169 
170 // Set all the values of the vector
171 RP3D_FORCE_INLINE void Vector2::setAllValues(decimal newX, decimal newY) {
172  x = newX;
173  y = newY;
174 }
175 
176 // Return the length of the vector
177 RP3D_FORCE_INLINE decimal Vector2::length() const {
178  return std::sqrt(x*x + y*y);
179 }
180 
181 // Return the square of the length of the vector
182 RP3D_FORCE_INLINE decimal Vector2::lengthSquare() const {
183  return x*x + y*y;
184 }
185 
186 // Scalar product of two vectors (RP3D_FORCE_INLINE)
187 RP3D_FORCE_INLINE decimal Vector2::dot(const Vector2& vector) const {
188  return (x*vector.x + y*vector.y);
189 }
190 
191 // Normalize the vector
192 RP3D_FORCE_INLINE void Vector2::normalize() {
193  decimal l = length();
194  if (l < MACHINE_EPSILON) {
195  return;
196  }
197  x /= l;
198  y /= l;
199 }
200 
201 // Return the corresponding absolute value vector
202 RP3D_FORCE_INLINE Vector2 Vector2::getAbsoluteVector() const {
203  return Vector2(std::abs(x), std::abs(y));
204 }
205 
206 // Return the axis with the minimal value
207 RP3D_FORCE_INLINE int Vector2::getMinAxis() const {
208  return (x < y ? 0 : 1);
209 }
210 
211 // Return the axis with the maximal value
212 RP3D_FORCE_INLINE int Vector2::getMaxAxis() const {
213  return (x < y ? 1 : 0);
214 }
215 
216 // Return true if the vector is unit and false otherwise
217 RP3D_FORCE_INLINE bool Vector2::isUnit() const {
218  return reactphysics3d::approxEqual(lengthSquare(), decimal(1.0));
219 }
220 
221 // Return true if the values are not NAN OR INF
222 RP3D_FORCE_INLINE bool Vector2::isFinite() const {
223  return std::isfinite(x) && std::isfinite(y);
224 }
225 
226 // Return true if the vector is the zero vector
227 RP3D_FORCE_INLINE bool Vector2::isZero() const {
228  return reactphysics3d::approxEqual(lengthSquare(), decimal(0.0));
229 }
230 
231 // Overloaded operator for the equality condition
232 RP3D_FORCE_INLINE bool Vector2::operator== (const Vector2& vector) const {
233  return (x == vector.x && y == vector.y);
234 }
235 
236 // Overloaded operator for the is different condition
237 RP3D_FORCE_INLINE bool Vector2::operator!= (const Vector2& vector) const {
238  return !(*this == vector);
239 }
240 
241 // Overloaded operator for addition with assignment
242 RP3D_FORCE_INLINE Vector2& Vector2::operator+=(const Vector2& vector) {
243  x += vector.x;
244  y += vector.y;
245  return *this;
246 }
247 
248 // Overloaded operator for substraction with assignment
249 RP3D_FORCE_INLINE Vector2& Vector2::operator-=(const Vector2& vector) {
250  x -= vector.x;
251  y -= vector.y;
252  return *this;
253 }
254 
255 // Overloaded operator for multiplication with a number with assignment
256 RP3D_FORCE_INLINE Vector2& Vector2::operator*=(decimal number) {
257  x *= number;
258  y *= number;
259  return *this;
260 }
261 
262 // Overloaded operator for division by a number with assignment
263 RP3D_FORCE_INLINE Vector2& Vector2::operator/=(decimal number) {
264  assert(number > std::numeric_limits<decimal>::epsilon());
265  x /= number;
266  y /= number;
267  return *this;
268 }
269 
270 // Overloaded operator for value access
271 RP3D_FORCE_INLINE decimal& Vector2::operator[] (int index) {
272  return (&x)[index];
273 }
274 
275 // Overloaded operator for value access
276 RP3D_FORCE_INLINE const decimal& Vector2::operator[] (int index) const {
277  return (&x)[index];
278 }
279 
280 // Overloaded operator for addition
281 RP3D_FORCE_INLINE Vector2 operator+(const Vector2& vector1, const Vector2& vector2) {
282  return Vector2(vector1.x + vector2.x, vector1.y + vector2.y);
283 }
284 
285 // Overloaded operator for substraction
286 RP3D_FORCE_INLINE Vector2 operator-(const Vector2& vector1, const Vector2& vector2) {
287  return Vector2(vector1.x - vector2.x, vector1.y - vector2.y);
288 }
289 
290 // Overloaded operator for the negative of a vector
291 RP3D_FORCE_INLINE Vector2 operator-(const Vector2& vector) {
292  return Vector2(-vector.x, -vector.y);
293 }
294 
295 // Overloaded operator for multiplication with a number
296 RP3D_FORCE_INLINE Vector2 operator*(const Vector2& vector, decimal number) {
297  return Vector2(number * vector.x, number * vector.y);
298 }
299 
300 // Overloaded operator for multiplication of two vectors
301 RP3D_FORCE_INLINE Vector2 operator*(const Vector2& vector1, const Vector2& vector2) {
302  return Vector2(vector1.x * vector2.x, vector1.y * vector2.y);
303 }
304 
305 // Overloaded operator for division by a number
306 RP3D_FORCE_INLINE Vector2 operator/(const Vector2& vector, decimal number) {
307  assert(number > MACHINE_EPSILON);
308  return Vector2(vector.x / number, vector.y / number);
309 }
310 
311 // Overload operator for division between two vectors
312 RP3D_FORCE_INLINE Vector2 operator/(const Vector2& vector1, const Vector2& vector2) {
313  assert(vector2.x > MACHINE_EPSILON);
314  assert(vector2.y > MACHINE_EPSILON);
315  return Vector2(vector1.x / vector2.x, vector1.y / vector2.y);
316 }
317 
318 // Overloaded operator for multiplication with a number
319 RP3D_FORCE_INLINE Vector2 operator*(decimal number, const Vector2& vector) {
320  return vector * number;
321 }
322 
323 // Overloaded less than operator for ordering to be used inside std::set for instance
324 RP3D_FORCE_INLINE bool Vector2::operator<(const Vector2& vector) const {
325  return (x == vector.x ? y < vector.y : x < vector.x);
326 }
327 
328 // Return a vector taking the minimum components of two vectors
329 RP3D_FORCE_INLINE Vector2 Vector2::min(const Vector2& vector1, const Vector2& vector2) {
330  return Vector2(std::min(vector1.x, vector2.x),
331  std::min(vector1.y, vector2.y));
332 }
333 
334 // Return a vector taking the maximum components of two vectors
335 RP3D_FORCE_INLINE Vector2 Vector2::max(const Vector2& vector1, const Vector2& vector2) {
336  return Vector2(std::max(vector1.x, vector2.x),
337  std::max(vector1.y, vector2.y));
338 }
339 
340 // Get the string representation
341 RP3D_FORCE_INLINE std::string Vector2::to_string() const {
342  return "Vector2(" + std::to_string(x) + "," + std::to_string(y) + ")";
343 }
344 
345 // Return the zero vector
346 RP3D_FORCE_INLINE Vector2 Vector2::zero() {
347  return Vector2(0, 0);
348 }
349 
350 // Function to test if two vectors are (almost) equal
351 RP3D_FORCE_INLINE bool approxEqual(const Vector2& vec1, const Vector2& vec2, decimal epsilon = MACHINE_EPSILON) {
352  return approxEqual(vec1.x, vec2.x, epsilon) && approxEqual(vec1.y, vec2.y, epsilon);
353 }
354 
355 }
356 
357 #endif
